pageContext.description: Yellowish bronze, surface decayed; iron rest distributed over surface, more thickly for the handle should have been
pageContext.associations: Found near a piece of skull, at River Wreake, Syoton, 19 feet below surface of ground and 11 feet below bottom of River,in grave, lying on red marl under 17 or 18 feet of bluish mud. Skulls of sheep or goat and bos longiforms found above it.
pageContext.publications: Translations of the Leicestershire Literary & Philosophical Society ix (1888) pp. 25, 26
pageContext.collection: Leicestershire Museum, given by Mr. J. Allon McDonald, 1874
pageContext.remarks: The above were brought to light in widening the railway bridge across the Wreake for the Midland Railway Co. Jan 1873. Mr. J.A. McDonald was the Company's Engineer.
